metadata: This notebooks supports the documentation of the current condition, access, and location of Cold War and earlier civil defenses in Aarhus municipality

FORM1SECTION1.sectiondescriptionFORM1SECTION1: Here you can describe the shelter or other feature that you encounter. Please beware that if you encounter multiple shelters clustered together (each will have its own emergency exit), you need to record each one individually. You may suggest the subtype (number of iterations) in the Subtype field of the each shelter that is part of the cluster. That way, an individual shelters of type I will have subtype A, while clusters of two will results in two shelter records of type I and subtype B. Consult your supervisor if in doubt.

FORM1SECTION2.sectiondescriptionFORM1SECTION2: Describe here the elements of the shelter, including the emergency exit on top, the entryway and other associated features.

metadata.pre_description: This notebooks supports the documentation of the current condition, access, and location of Cold War and earlier civil defenses in Aarhus municipality

FORM1SECTION1.sectiondescriptionFORM1SECTION1: Here you can describe the shelter or other feature that you encounter. Please beware that if you encounter multiple shelters clustered together (each will have its own emergency exit), you need to record each one individually. You may suggest the subtype (number of iterations) in the Subtype field of the each shelter that is part of the cluster. That way, an individual shelters of type I will have subtype A, while clusters of two will results in two shelter records of type I and subtype B. Consult your supervisor if in doubt.

FORM1SECTION2.sectiondescriptionFORM1SECTION2: Describe here the elements of the shelter, including the emergency exit on top, the entryway and other associated features.

component-parameters.helperText:
If your feature is a shelter, then please select an appropriate type (as best as you can surmise from the visible remains) . If the feature is something else (depo, or other), select Other and describe in the Annotation, please. Shelter types refer to the plan of the shelter below ground. Indicate which is the likely type if you can make it out during the visit. Use the certainty slider in case of uncertainty!

Type I, som er et kuppelformet rum med en vægtykkelse på 25 cm. Beton. Rummet er støbt over en forskalling, og der er plads til 50 personer i rummet. Type II, som er et hesteskoformet rør støbt over en forskalling, ligeledes med plads til 50 personer og en vægtykkelse på 25 cm. Beton. Type III, også kaldet Århus modellen, som er et rørformet rum lavet af færdigstøbte betonelementer med en vægtykkelse på 15 cm. Beton. Der er også plads til 50 personer. Denne type blev fremstillet af firmaet A/S Højgaard & Schultz og er kun blevet bygget i Århus. Type IV<-b>, er et kuppelformet rum støbt over en forskalling og med en vægtykkelse på 25 cm. Beton. Der er plads til 50 personer pr. rum. Type V<-b>, er et cylinderformet rum støbt over en forskalling og med en vægtykkelse på 30 cm. Beton. Der er ligeledes plads til 50 personer pr. rum. Type VI, er et kasseformet rum støbt over en forskalling og med en vægtykkelse på 40 cm. Beton, med plads til 50 personer
component-parameters.name: newfieldbecf0b36
newfield6062ed39
component-parameters.helperText: Human Readable ID

component-parameters.name: hridFORM1
component-parameters.helperText: Human Readable ID

This attribute is relevant only to shelters and is not mandatory.If your feature is a shelter, please indicate what subtype it is a part of. Shelter subtype is indicated by letters, such as A,B,C,D,.. and refer to the number of times the original shelter design is repeated in one location. Disse grundtyper kunne udbygges i grupper á 2-3 helt op til 5 rum, så der på den måde kunne være plads til helt op til 250 personer i dækningsgravene. Systemet var bygget sådan, at der var en hovedtype og en model, for eksempel type IIB. Der er således i alt 17 forskellige udgaver af betondækningsgrave.

component-parameters.helperText: Take a photo of the entire extent of the feature with a scale within.
component-parameters.label: Overview Photo

component-parameters.name: newfieldfc1bcefa
component-parameters.helperText: Take a point while standing on top of the shelter (if inaccessible make a note of where you stand in the annotation)
component-parameters.label: Take point from GPS

component-parameters.helperText: Describe the environs of the shelter or feature, and specify its address so that others can find it easily after you.
component-parameters.name: newfield89dda018

component-parameters.helperText: Describe what covers the surface of the shelter. Is it overgrown with grass, covered with shrubs, or converted into a playground or ashpalted area?
component-parameters.name: newfieldb99a2c02

component-parameters.helperText: Describe briefly the setting of the shelter. If multiple different kinds of landuse co-occur, choose the majority and then add the rest in annotation
component-parameters.name: newfielde350da06

component-parameters.helperText: Emergency exit is a chimney-like feature on top of most shelters. It can be either square or round in plan and may have little vents/windows in it. Indicate its plan, please. If not detectable, select NA.
component-parameters.name: newfieldaca62901

component-parameters.helperText: Emergency exit is usually on top of a shelter feature, but its specific location will vary with shelter type. A round shelter will have this exit on the top center, while a square shelter will have it off center, to the side or a corner. Please indicate its location relative to shelter plan and use Annotation or pictures for more detail
component-parameters.name: newfield6407e68f

component-parameters.helperText: Helper Text
component-parameters.name: newfield0452bda3

component-parameters.helperText: Take an extra photo of the emergency exit if it is obscured in the Overview photo
component-parameters.label: Emergency exit photo

component-parameters.helperText: The entrance to a shelter is usually through stairs down a gate, often covered by concrete slabs, but sometimes also doorways or other.
component-parameters.name: newfield5a8613e3

component-parameters.helperText: Choose a field from the dropdown

options.label: Sealed (as in concrete seals a doorway)

options.value: Barred (concrete slabs or earthen cover bar access fully or partially
options.label: Barred (concrete slabs or earthen cover bar access fully or partially

component-parameters.helperText: Can you find a turned tube "swan neck ventilation" near the foot of the shelter? If so, measure its distance to the emergency exit in METERS

InputLabelProps.label: Distance from swan-neck to emergency exit (m)

component-parameters.name: newfield9f1d67e1

component-parameters.helperText: Use a compass to measure which way the doorway is facing. Use this terminology: West-northwest (WNW) North-northwest (NNW) North-northeast (NNE) East-northeast (ENE) East-southeast (ESE) South-southeast (SSE) South-southwest (SSW) West-southwest (WSW)
